verses.t: Fret{H2734} not thyself because of evildoers{H7489}, neither be thou envious{H7065} against the workers{H6213} of iniquity{H5766}.
For they shall soon{H4120} be cut down{H5243} like the grass{H2682}, and wither{H5034} as the green{H3418} herb{H1877}.
Trust{H982} Lordin the {H3068}, and do{H6213} good{H2896}; so shalt thou dwell{H7931} in the land{H776}, and verily{H530} thou shalt be fed{H7462}.verily: Heb. in truth, or, stableness
Delight{H6026} Lordthyself also in the {H3068}; and he shall give{H5414} thee the desires{H4862} of thine heart{H3820}.
Commit{H1556} thy way{H1870} Lordunto the {H3068}; trust{H982} also in him; and he shall bring it to pass{H6213}.Commit…: Heb. Roll thy way upon
And he shall bring forth{H3318} thy righteousness{H6664} as the light{H216}, and thy judgment{H4941} as the noonday{H6672}.

Rest{H1826} Lordin the {H3068}, and wait patiently{H2342} for him: fret{H2734} not thyself because of him who prospereth{H6743} in his way{H1870}, because of the man{H376} who bringeth{H6213} wicked devices{H4209} to pass{H6213}.Rest in: Heb. Be silent to
Cease{H7503} from anger{H639}, and forsake{H5800} wrath{H2534}: fret{H2734} not thyself in any wise{H389} to do evil{H7489}.
For evildoers{H7489} shall be cut off{H3772}: but those that wait{H6960} Lordupon the {H3068}, they shall inherit{H3423} the earth{H776}.
For yet a little while{H4592}, and the wicked{H7563} shall not be: yea, thou shalt diligently consider{H995} his place{H4725}, and it shall not be.
But the meek{H6035} shall inherit{H3423} the earth{H776}; and shall delight{H6026} themselves in the abundance{H7230} of peace{H7965}.
The wicked{H7563} plotteth{H2161} against the just{H6662}and gnasheth{H2786} upon him with his teeth{H8127}.plotteth: or, practiseth
The Lord{H136} shall laugh{H7832} at him: for he seeth{H7200} that his day{H3117} is coming{H935}.

The wicked{H7563} have drawn out{H6605} the sword{H2719}, and have bent{H1869} their bow{H7198}, to cast down{H5307} the poor{H6041} and needy{H34}, and to slay{H2873} such as be of upright{H3477} conversation{H1870}.such…: Heb. the upright of way
Their sword{H2719} shall enter{H935} into their own heart{H3820}, and their bows{H7198} shall be broken{H7665}.
A little{H4592} that a righteous man{H6662} hath is better{H2896} than the riches{H1995} of many{H7227} wicked{H7563}.
For the arms{H2220} of the wicked{H7563} shall be broken{H7665}: Lordbut the {H3068} upholdeth{H5564} the righteous{H6662}.
LordThe {H3068} knoweth{H3045} the days{H3117} of the upright{H8549}: and their inheritance{H5159} shall be for ever{H5769}.
They shall not be ashamed{H954} in the evil{H7451} time{H6256}: and in the days{H3117} of famine{H7459} they shall be satisfied{H7646}.

But the wicked{H7563} shall perish{H6}, and the enemies{H341} Lordof the {H3068} shall be as the fat{H3368} of lambs{H3733}: they shall consume{H3615}; into smoke{H6227} shall they consume away{H3615}.the fat: Heb. the preciousness
The wicked{H7563} borroweth{H3867}, and payeth not again{H7999}: but the righteous{H6662} sheweth mercy{H2603}, and giveth{H5414}.
For such as be blessed{H1288} of him shall inherit{H3423} the earth{H776}; and they that be cursed{H7043} of him shall be cut off{H3772}.
The steps{H4703} of a good man{H1397} are ordered{H3559} Lordby the {H3068}: and he delighteth{H2654} in his way{H1870}.ordered: or, established
Though he fall{H5307}, he shall not be utterly cast down{H2904}: Lordfor the {H3068} upholdeth{H5564} him with his hand{H3027}.
I have been young{H5288}, and now am old{H2204}; yet have I not seen{H7200} the righteous{H6662} forsaken{H5800}, nor his seed{H2233} begging{H1245} bread{H3899}.
He is ever{H3117} merciful{H2603}, and lendeth{H3867}; and his seed{H2233} is blessed{H1293}.ever: Heb. all the day
Depart{H5493} from evil{H7451}, and do{H6213} good{H2896}; and dwell{H7931} for evermore{H5769}.

LordFor the {H3068} loveth{H157} judgment{H4941}, and forsaketh{H5800} not his saints{H2623}; they are preserved{H8104} for ever{H5769}: but the seed{H2233} of the wicked{H7563} shall be cut off{H3772}.
The righteous{H6662} shall inherit{H3423} the land{H776}, and dwell{H7931} therein for ever{H5703}.
The mouth{H6310} of the righteous{H6662} speaketh{H1897} wisdom{H2451}, and his tongue{H3956} talketh{H1696} of judgment{H4941}.
The law{H8451} of his God{H430} is in his heart{H3820}; none of his steps{H838} shall slide{H4571}.steps: or, goings
The wicked{H7563} watcheth{H6822} the righteous{H6662}, and seeketh{H1245} to slay{H4191} him.
LordThe {H3068} will not leave{H5800} him in his hand{H3027}, nor condemn{H7561} him when he is judged{H8199}.
Wait{H6960} Lordon the {H3068}, and keep{H8104} his way{H1870}, and he shall exalt{H7311} thee to inherit{H3423} the land{H776}: when the wicked{H7563} are cut off{H3772}, thou shalt see{H7200} it.
I have seen{H7200} the wicked{H7563} in great power{H6184}, and spreading{H6168} himself like a green{H7488} bay tree{H249}.a green…: or, a green tree that groweth in his own soil
Yet he passed away{H5674}, and, lo, he was not: yea, I sought{H1245} him, but he could not be found{H4672}.
Mark{H8104} the perfect{H8535} man, and behold{H7200} the upright{H3477}: for the end{H319} of that man{H376} is peace{H7965}.
But the transgressors{H6586} shall be destroyed{H8045} together{H3162}: the end{H319} of the wicked{H7563} shall be cut off{H3772}.
But the salvation{H8668} of the righteous{H6662} is Lordof the {H3068}: he is their strength{H4581} in the time{H6256} of trouble{H6869}.
LordAnd the {H3068} shall help{H5826} them, and deliver{H6403} them: he shall deliver{H6403} them from the wicked{H7563}, and save{H3467} them, because they trust{H2620} in him.
